intro: Tryphostemma schlechteri, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed species. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange and are clustered in umbels, attracting various pollinators. The plant produces a milky sap, which is a common feature among members of its family.
